title: Pixel 3 keeps switching off (sometimes before it fully boots, sometimes a minute or so after)
content:
I was charging my phone through the night, on my wireless charging stand.

I noticed through the night that my phone was off and the "battery symbol" was flashing middle of the screen (I figured I hadn't placed my phone on the wireless charging stand correctly and it had died).

Next morning I woke up attempted to charge it, and then switch it on. I got as far as the Google logo and then it crashed. Later in the day I managed to boot up successfully and get about a minute of usage before it would crash and switch off again (screen just cuts out). I noticed battery was around the 69% mark.

After this spell, it has returned to crashing before I'm able to boot up.

I have managed to reset to factory default but that does not seem to have fixed the issue.

Thanks in advance
